page.title: 11THE ISLE.
page.content: The ecology of the area is varied.It is fairly well wooded and the large majority of the trees are oaks,with a few beech and ash.The hedges are generally hawthorn or elderand are largely overgrown.The wildflowers are also varied_common cow parsley, rarer purple clary.The area is dominated by the river Severn and is largely enclosed within a mender,where there is also a small lake,possibly glacial in origin.It is edged with the now-familiar dead elm trees.The area is home to familiar animals,like rabbits and mice,as wellas to king- fishers,herons and partridge. There is a badger set in the woods.
